title: John Chapter 8 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on John chapter 8 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: John Chapter 8 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of John Chapter 8.

questions.question: Where did Jesus go according to John 8:1?
options: Mount of Olives
Mount Sinai
Mount Carmel
Mount Zion
questions.correctAnswer: Mount of Olives
questions.explanation: John 8:1 states that Jesus went unto the mount of Olives.

questions.question: What time of day did Jesus come into the temple as mentioned in John 8:2?
options: Early in the morning
At noon
Late at night
In the afternoon
questions.correctAnswer: Early in the morning
questions.explanation: John 8:2 says Jesus came again into the temple early in the morning.

questions.question: Who brought the woman taken in adultery to Jesus in John 8:3?
options: Scribes and Pharisees
Disciples
Romans
Sadducees
questions.correctAnswer: Scribes and Pharisees
questions.explanation: John 8:3 mentions that the scribes and Pharisees brought the woman to Jesus.

questions.question: What punishment did Moses command for adultery according to John 8:5?
options: Stoning
Exile
Flogging
Burning
questions.correctAnswer: Stoning
questions.explanation: John 8:5 states that Moses commanded those taken in adultery to be stoned.

questions.question: What did Jesus say to those without sin in John 8:7?
options: Let him first cast a stone
Forgive the woman
Leave her alone
Go and sin no more
questions.correctAnswer: Let him first cast a stone
questions.explanation: John 8:7 quotes Jesus saying, 'He that is without sin among you, let him first cast a stone at her.'

questions.question: What did Jesus write on the ground as mentioned in John 8:6 and John 8:8?
options: It is not specified
The Ten Commandments
The sins of the accusers
The Law of Moses
questions.correctAnswer: It is not specified
questions.explanation: John 8:6 and John 8:8 mention Jesus stooping down and writing on the ground but do not specify what he wrote.

questions.question: What did Jesus tell the woman after her accusers left in John 8:11?
options: Neither do I condemn thee: go, and sin no more
Go and tell no one
You are forgiven
You must leave the temple
questions.correctAnswer: Neither do I condemn thee: go, and sin no more
questions.explanation: John 8:11 records Jesus saying to the woman, 'Neither do I condemn thee: go, and sin no more.'

questions.question: What did Jesus say about himself in John 8:12?
options: I am the light of the world
I am the bread of life
I am the good shepherd
I am the door
questions.correctAnswer: I am the light of the world
questions.explanation: John 8:12 quotes Jesus saying, 'I am the light of the world.'

questions.question: How did Jesus describe the source of his testimony in John 8:18?
options: I bear witness of myself, and the Father beareth witness of me
I rely on the prophets
I have no witness
The people testify for me
questions.correctAnswer: I bear witness of myself, and the Father beareth witness of me
questions.explanation: John 8:18 states Jesus bears witness of himself and the Father sent him bears witness of him.

questions.question: What did Jesus say would make you free in John 8:32?
options: The truth
The law
The prophets
The commandments
questions.correctAnswer: The truth
questions.explanation: John 8:32 says, 'And ye shall know the truth, and the truth shall make you free.'

questions.question: True or False: Jesus said in John 8:34 that whoever commits sin is the servant of sin.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: John 8:34 states, 'Whosoever committeth sin is the servant of sin.'

questions.question: True or False: In John 8:58, Jesus said 'Before Abraham was, I am.'
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: John 8:58 records Jesus saying, 'Before Abraham was, I am.'

questions.question: True or False: According to John 8:24, Jesus said if you do not believe that He is, you shall die in your sins.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: John 8:24 says, 'if ye believe not that I am he, ye shall die in your sins.'

questions.question: Complete the verse from John 8:12: 'I am the light of the ______: he that followeth me shall not walk in darkness, but shall have the light of life.'
options: world
people
temple
heavens
questions.correctAnswer: world
questions.explanation: John 8:12 states, 'I am the light of the world.'

questions.question: Complete the verse from John 8:32: 'And ye shall know the _______, and the truth shall make you free.'
options: truth
way
light
word
questions.correctAnswer: truth
questions.explanation: John 8:32 reads, 'And ye shall know the truth, and the truth shall make you free.'

medium.title: John Chapter 8 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from John Chapter 8 to real-life situations.

questions.question: A fellow believer struggles with guilt after sinning. Based on John 8, what biblical truth would you share about forgiveness?
options: Jesus does not condemn but calls to sin no more
One must be punished publicly to be forgiven
Forgiveness requires proving innocence first
Sin cannot be forgiven once committed
questions.correctAnswer: Jesus does not condemn but calls to sin no more
questions.explanation: John 8:10-11 shows Jesus telling the woman caught in adultery that He does not condemn her and commands her to 'go, and sin no more,' demonstrating forgiveness and a call to repentance.

questions.question: How does John 8 teach us about humility when dealing with others' faults?
options: Only those without sin should judge others
We should expose others’ faults publicly
Judging others is always necessary
Ignore sin completely to maintain peace
questions.correctAnswer: Only those without sin should judge others
questions.explanation: Jesus says in John 8:7 that 'He that is without sin among you, let him first cast a stone at her,' emphasizing humility and self-examination before judging others (John 8:5-7, 9).

questions.question: What does John 8 teach about the source of true spiritual freedom?
options: The Son makes you free indeed
Freedom comes from political power
Freedom is achieved by strict law-keeping
Freedom comes from wealth and possessions
questions.correctAnswer: The Son makes you free indeed
questions.explanation: John 8:36 states 'If the Son therefore shall make you free, ye shall be free indeed,' teaching that true freedom is found through Jesus Christ (John 8:31-36).

questions.question: A believer is confused about Jesus' identity. Based on John 8, how does Jesus affirm who He is?
options: He is the light of the world
He is a prophet like Moses
He is a Samaritan
He is a mere teacher
questions.correctAnswer: He is the light of the world
questions.explanation: Jesus declares in John 8:12, 'I am the light of the world,' affirming His divine role in guiding and illuminating spiritual life (John 8:12, 58).

questions.question: How does John 8 instruct believers to respond to temptation and sin?
options: Recognize sin makes one servant to sin and seek freedom through Christ
Ignore temptation as it will pass
Justify sin by blaming others
Accept sin as part of life
questions.correctAnswer: Recognize sin makes one servant to sin and seek freedom through Christ
questions.explanation: John 8:34-36 explains that whoever commits sin is a servant of sin, but the Son can set them free, teaching believers to seek Christ for victory over sin (John 8:34-36).

questions.question: What does John 8 teach about continuing in Jesus' word for discipleship?
options: Continuing in Jesus’ word makes one a true disciple
Discipleship depends on rituals only
Faith alone without obedience is enough
Discipleship is based on heritage
questions.correctAnswer: Continuing in Jesus’ word makes one a true disciple
questions.explanation: John 8:31 states, 'If ye continue in my word, then are ye my disciples indeed,' emphasizing obedience and perseverance in Jesus’ teachings as marks of true discipleship (John 8:31-32).

questions.question: What practical lesson about integrity can be drawn from Jesus' teaching in John 8?
options: Jesus’ testimony about Himself is true because it is supported by the Father
Self-testimony is unreliable and should be ignored
Only human judgment matters
Integrity depends on public opinion
questions.correctAnswer: Jesus’ testimony about Himself is true because it is supported by the Father
questions.explanation: In John 8:14-18, Jesus explains His testimony is true because the Father who sent Him also bears witness, teaching believers to ground integrity in God's truth, not human opinion.

questions.question: How should a Christian view accusations or misunderstandings from others, based on John 8?
options: Remain faithful and trust God’s timing
Retaliate immediately
Avoid all contact with accusers
Change beliefs to please others
questions.correctAnswer: Remain faithful and trust God’s timing
questions.explanation: John 8:20 shows Jesus teaching in the temple despite opposition, and no one laid hands on Him 'for his hour was not yet come,' illustrating trust in God’s timing amid opposition (John 8:20, 51).

questions.question: True or False: According to John 8, Jesus claims that knowing Him is the same as knowing the Father.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Jesus states in John 8:19 that if people knew Him, they would know His Father also, affirming their identity is closely connected (John 8:19, 42).

questions.question: True or False: John 8 teaches that spiritual blindness prevents people from understanding Jesus' words.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: In John 8:43-47 Jesus explains that those not of God do not hear God's words, indicating spiritual blindness hinders understanding (John 8:43-47).

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Jesus said, 'Before Abraham was, ___.'
options: I am
I will come
I was born
I walked
questions.correctAnswer: I am
questions.explanation: John 8:58 quotes Jesus saying, 'Before Abraham was, I am,' declaring His eternal existence and divinity (John 8:58).

questions.question: What does Jesus teach about judging others in John 8?
options: He judges no man but His judgment is true when He does
He encourages harsh judgment for sinners
Judgment is only for religious leaders
Judgment is unnecessary
questions.correctAnswer: He judges no man but His judgment is true when He does
questions.explanation: Jesus says in John 8:15-16 that He judges no man, but if He judges, His judgment is true because He is not alone, but the Father is with Him (John 8:15-16).

questions.question: How does John 8 instruct believers about the relationship between love for God and love for Jesus?
options: If God were your Father, ye would love me
Love for God and Jesus are unrelated
Love for Jesus is less important than law
Love is only shown by sacrifice
questions.correctAnswer: If God were your Father, ye would love me
questions.explanation: In John 8:42, Jesus says that if God were their Father, they would love Him, showing the inseparable link between loving God and loving Jesus (John 8:41-42).

questions.question: According to John 8, what should be the believer's response to hearing and continuing in Jesus' word?
options: They shall know the truth, and the truth shall make them free
They will be judged harshly
They will lose their freedom
They should question and doubt
questions.correctAnswer: They shall know the truth, and the truth shall make them free
questions.explanation: John 8:31-32 teaches that continuing in Jesus' word leads to knowing the truth, which brings freedom (John 8:31-32).

questions.question: What does John 8 teach about the consequences of rejecting Jesus’ words?
options: Those who reject Jesus will die in their sins
They will gain worldly power
They will be immediately forgiven
They will be celebrated by God
questions.correctAnswer: Those who reject Jesus will die in their sins
questions.explanation: Jesus warns in John 8:24 and 21 that those who do not believe in Him will die in their sins, underscoring the serious consequences of unbelief (John 8:21-24).

hard.title: John Chapter 8 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from John Chapter 8.

questions.question: In John 8, when the Pharisees bring the woman caught in adultery to Jesus, what Old Testament law do they reference as the basis for stoning her?
options: The law given by Moses
The law of the prophets
The law of the judges
The law of the priests
questions.correctAnswer: The law given by Moses
questions.explanation: John 8:5 states that Moses in the law commanded that such a woman should be stoned, referencing the Mosaic Law given in the Pentateuch.

questions.question: What literary device does Jesus employ when He stoops down and writes on the ground during the confrontation with the adulterous woman?
options: Irony
Chiasmus
Silent rebuke
Metaphor
questions.correctAnswer: Silent rebuke
questions.explanation: In John 8:6-8, Jesus stoops down and writes on the ground as though He heard them not, which functions as a silent rebuke and a pause to provoke self-examination among the accusers.

questions.question: How does Jesus' statement 'He that is without sin among you, let him first cast a stone at her' demonstrate a principle also found in which Old Testament teaching?
options: The prohibition of false witness in Exodus
The call for mercy in Micah
The emphasis on justice balanced with mercy in Deuteronomy
The commandment to love your neighbor in Leviticus
questions.correctAnswer: The call for mercy in Micah
questions.explanation: Jesus’ appeal to sinlessness echoes Micah 6:8’s emphasis on mercy and justice, highlighting mercy over strict legalism.

questions.question: What is the significance of Jesus declaring Himself 'the light of the world' in John 8:12 in the context of Hebrew Scripture symbolism?
options: Light symbolizes God's presence and guidance
Light represents the law only
Light is used exclusively for kingship titles
Light is a metaphor for wealth
questions.correctAnswer: Light symbolizes God's presence and guidance
questions.explanation: In Hebrew Scripture, light often symbolizes God's presence and truth (e.g., Psalm 27:1), and Jesus uses this imagery in John 8:12 to assert His divine role as the spiritual guide.

questions.question: How does Jesus’ claim 'Before Abraham was, I am' in John 8:58 relate to the divine name revealed in the Old Testament?
options: 'I am' echoes God's self-identification in Exodus 3:14
It refers to the name 'El Shaddai'
It is a common Jewish greeting
It is a reference to the Messiah’s title
questions.correctAnswer: 'I am' echoes God's self-identification in Exodus 3:14
questions.explanation: Jesus uses the phrase 'I am,' directly connecting to God's self-identification to Moses in Exodus 3:14, thus asserting His divinity and eternal existence.

questions.question: In John 8, Jesus contrasts those who are 'from beneath' with Himself who is 'from above.' What theological theme does this dualism represent?
options: The conflict between earthly and heavenly origins
The division between Jews and Samaritans
The contrast between law and grace
The difference between Pharisees and Sadducees
questions.correctAnswer: The conflict between earthly and heavenly origins
questions.explanation: John 8:23 establishes a spiritual dualism reflecting the origin of human beings either from earthly (sinful) or heavenly (divine) realms, a theme prevalent throughout the Johannine writings.

questions.question: What is the significance of Jesus’ teaching about sin making one a 'servant of sin' in John 8:34, in light of Old Testament slavery motifs?
options: It reflects the bondage and liberation themes in Exodus
It is a new teaching without Old Testament background
It contradicts the law of Moses
It refers to literal slavery practices
questions.correctAnswer: It reflects the bondage and liberation themes in Exodus
questions.explanation: Jesus’ metaphor in John 8:34 references slavery as a symbol of spiritual bondage, drawing on Exodus themes of Israel’s liberation from physical and spiritual slavery.

questions.question: Which Old Testament figure is referenced by Jesus as having 'rejoiced to see my day' in John 8:56, indicating a typological foreshadowing?
options: Abraham
Moses
David
Isaiah
questions.correctAnswer: Abraham
questions.explanation: John 8:56 explicitly mentions Abraham rejoicing to see Jesus’ day, showing typology where Abraham anticipates the Messianic fulfillment.

questions.question: What is the significance of Jesus’ statement 'If a man keep my saying, he shall never see death' in the cultural context of Second Temple Judaism?
options: It promises spiritual eternal life contrasting physical death
It is a promise of physical immortality
It reflects a popular Jewish resurrection doctrine
It is a metaphor for social acceptance
questions.correctAnswer: It promises spiritual eternal life contrasting physical death
questions.explanation: In John 8:51, Jesus offers eternal life through adherence to His word, echoing Jewish hopes for life beyond physical death but emphasizing spiritual freedom.

questions.question: How does Jesus’ dialogue with the Jews accusing Him of having a devil (John 8:48) illustrate the Johannine theme of spiritual blindness?
options: It shows their inability to perceive divine truth
It indicates a historical conflict with Samaritans
It highlights Jesus’ weakness
It confirms Jesus’ demonic possession
questions.correctAnswer: It shows their inability to perceive divine truth
questions.explanation: John 8:43-48 emphasizes that the Jews’ accusations arise from their spiritual blindness and rejection of Jesus’ truth.

questions.question: What is the significance of the setting 'the treasury' where Jesus taught in John 8:20 in relation to temple practices?
options: It was a public place associated with offerings and tithes
It was a private room for priests only
It was outside the temple area
It was the place for sacrifice
questions.correctAnswer: It was a public place associated with offerings and tithes
questions.explanation: The treasury was where temple offerings were stored and collected, making it a significant public location for Jesus to teach and confront religious leaders (John 8:20).

questions.question: True or False: According to John 8, Jesus says that His testimony alone is insufficient and requires the testimony of others to be valid.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Jesus claims in John 8:14-18 that although He bears testimony of Himself, His testimony is true because the Father also bears witness, thus His testimony alone is sufficient.

questions.question: What intertextual connection is made by Jesus referencing 'the testimony of two men is true' in John 8:17?
options: It alludes to Deuteronomy 19:15 concerning legal testimony
It refers to the Psalms about witnesses
It quotes Isaiah about justice
It connects to Leviticus concerning covenant
questions.correctAnswer: It alludes to Deuteronomy 19:15 concerning legal testimony
questions.explanation: John 8:17 references Deuteronomy 19:15, which requires two or three witnesses to establish a matter, strengthening Jesus’ claim about His divine testimony.

questions.question: How does the theme of judgment in John 8:15-16 relate to Jewish concepts of Messiahship and divine authority?
options: Jesus claims His judgment is true because it is unified with the Father’s
Jesus rejects all forms of judgment
Jesus claims to judge according to Roman law
Jesus avoids the topic of judgment completely
questions.correctAnswer: Jesus claims His judgment is true because it is unified with the Father’s
questions.explanation: John 8:15-16 presents Jesus’ authority to judge as divine, aligned with the Father’s will, which is central to Jewish expectations of the Messiah as the righteous judge.

questions.question: In John 8:44, Jesus describes the devil as 'a murderer from the beginning' and 'the father of lies.' How does this description connect to the portrayal of Satan in the Hebrew Bible?
options: It echoes the serpent’s deception in Genesis 3
It originates solely in New Testament theology
It conflicts with Old Testament views
It refers only to a mythological figure
questions.correctAnswer: It echoes the serpent’s deception in Genesis 3
questions.explanation: Jesus’ description in John 8:44 alludes to the serpent’s role in Genesis 3 as deceiver and source of death, linking Satan’s character with early biblical narratives.

theological.title: John Chapter 8 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from John Chapter 8 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: In John 8, how does Jesus respond to the accusation against the woman taken in adultery?
options: He tells them to stone her immediately
He writes on the ground and challenges the accusers to cast the first stone if they are without sin
He dismisses the accusation without comment
He tells the woman to leave quietly
questions.correctAnswer: He writes on the ground and challenges the accusers to cast the first stone if they are without sin
questions.explanation: Jesus stooped down and wrote on the ground, then said, 'He that is without sin among you, let him first cast a stone at her' (John 8:6-7). This reflects God's mercy and judgment principles as seen in Leviticus 20:10 and Deuteronomy 17:7, emphasizing human sinfulness and God's justice.

questions.question: What title does Jesus claim for Himself in John 8:12, and what is its theological significance?
options: I am the bread of life
I am the light of the world
I am the good shepherd
I am the way, the truth, and the life
questions.correctAnswer: I am the light of the world
questions.explanation: Jesus declares, 'I am the light of the world: he that followeth me shall not walk in darkness, but shall have the light of life' (John 8:12). This signifies Christ as the divine revelation and source of spiritual illumination, consistent with Old Testament imagery of God as light (Psalm 27:1; Isaiah 9:2) and New Testament theology (1 John 1:5).

questions.question: According to John 8:14, on what basis does Jesus claim that His testimony about Himself is true?
options: Because He has many witnesses
Because He has a strong following
Because He knows where He came from and where He is going
Because the Pharisees agree with Him
questions.correctAnswer: Because He knows where He came from and where He is going
questions.explanation: Jesus says, 'Though I bear record of myself, yet my record is true: for I know whence I came, and whither I go' (John 8:14). His divine knowledge and origin affirm His truthfulness, aligning with the divine self-awareness seen in Isaiah 43:10 and John 1:1-4.

questions.question: What is the relationship between Jesus and the Father as described in John 8:16-18?
options: Jesus acts independently of the Father
Jesus and the Father bear witness together
The Father is unaware of Jesus' actions
Jesus denies the existence of the Father
questions.correctAnswer: Jesus and the Father bear witness together
questions.explanation: Jesus states, 'I am not alone, but I and the Father that sent me' and refers to the testimony of two men as true in the law (John 8:16-18). This emphasizes the unity and mutual witness between Jesus and God the Father, echoing the divine testimony concept in Deuteronomy 19:15 and 1 John 5:9.

questions.question: What does Jesus mean in John 8:23 when He says, 'Ye are from beneath; I am from above'?
options: He is referring to physical origins
He contrasts earthly origins with divine origin
He means they are from a lower social class
He implies they are from a nearby town
questions.correctAnswer: He contrasts earthly origins with divine origin
questions.explanation: Jesus contrasts human, earthly origin ('from beneath') with His divine, heavenly origin ('from above') (John 8:23). This reflects the distinction between fallen humanity and the divine nature of Christ as seen in Jeremiah 17:5 and Philippians 3:20.

questions.question: In John 8:24, Jesus warns people about dying in their sins. What condition does He give for not dying in sin?
options: If they obey the Law of Moses perfectly
If they believe that He is the Messiah
If they are descendants of Abraham
If they perform good works
questions.correctAnswer: If they believe that He is the Messiah
questions.explanation: Jesus says, 'if ye believe not that I am he, ye shall die in your sins' (John 8:24). Faith in Christ as the Messiah is the condition for salvation, consistent with John 3:16, Romans 10:9, and Isaiah 53:5.

questions.question: How does Jesus describe the nature of sin and its effect on a person in John 8:34?
options: Sin is a minor mistake
Sin enslaves a person, making them a servant of sin
Sin only affects external behavior
Sin can be ignored without consequence
questions.correctAnswer: Sin enslaves a person, making them a servant of sin
questions.explanation: Jesus states, 'Whosoever committeth sin is the servant of sin' (John 8:34). This reveals sin’s enslaving power, a theme echoed in Romans 6:16-18 and 2 Peter 2:19, highlighting the need for divine liberation.

questions.question: What does Jesus claim about the freedom He offers in John 8:36?
options: He offers political freedom
He offers financial freedom
If the Son makes you free, you shall be free indeed
He offers freedom through strict law adherence
questions.correctAnswer: If the Son makes you free, you shall be free indeed
questions.explanation: Jesus declares, 'If the Son therefore shall make you free, ye shall be free indeed' (John 8:36), indicating true spiritual freedom from sin and death, consistent with Galatians 5:1 and Romans 8:2.

questions.question: How does Jesus characterize the spiritual fatherhood of those who oppose Him in John 8:44?
options: They have no father
They are children of Abraham
They are of the devil, who is a murderer and liar
Their father is a prophet
questions.correctAnswer: They are of the devil, who is a murderer and liar
questions.explanation: Jesus says, 'Ye are of your father the devil... He was a murderer from the beginning, and abode not in the truth' (John 8:44). This identifies spiritual opposition to God as origin from Satan, consistent with Genesis 3, 1 John 3:8, and Ephesians 2:2.

questions.question: What is the significance of Jesus' statement in John 8:58, 'Before Abraham was, I am'?
options: He is claiming to have existed before Abraham, using the divine name 'I am'
He is saying he is younger than Abraham
He is denying the existence of Abraham
He is referring to a future event
questions.correctAnswer: He is claiming to have existed before Abraham, using the divine name 'I am'
questions.explanation: Jesus uses 'I am,' the divine name revealed in Exodus 3:14, to assert His eternal existence before Abraham (John 8:58), affirming His deity as supported by John 1:1-3 and Isaiah 43:10.

questions.question: According to John 8:31-32, what is required for someone to be Jesus' true disciple and to know the truth?
options: To continue in Jesus' word
To follow the traditions of the elders
To perform miracles
To attend the temple regularly
questions.correctAnswer: To continue in Jesus' word
questions.explanation: Jesus says, 'If ye continue in my word, then are ye my disciples indeed: And ye shall know the truth, and the truth shall make you free' (John 8:31-32). This highlights discipleship as ongoing faith and obedience, paralleling Matthew 28:20 and James 1:22.

questions.question: What accusation do the Jews make against Jesus in John 8:48, and how does Jesus respond in John 8:49?
options: They accuse Him of being a Samaritan and having a devil; Jesus denies having a devil and says He honors the Father
They accuse Him of blasphemy; Jesus agrees
They accuse Him of theft; Jesus ignores them
They accuse Him of being a prophet; Jesus confirms it
questions.correctAnswer: They accuse Him of being a Samaritan and having a devil; Jesus denies having a devil and says He honors the Father
questions.explanation: The Jews say, 'Thou art a Samaritan, and hast a devil' (John 8:48), to which Jesus replies, 'I have not a devil; but I honour my Father' (John 8:49). This exchange highlights rejection and Jesus' faithfulness to God, consistent with 1 John 3:10 and Matthew 10:40.

questions.question: In John 8:51, what promise does Jesus make to those who keep His word?
options: They will never be hungry
They shall never see death
They will be wealthy
They will avoid persecution
questions.correctAnswer: They shall never see death
questions.explanation: Jesus says, 'If a man keep my saying, he shall never see death' (John 8:51), referring to eternal life, a theme consistent with John 3:16, Romans 6:23, and Revelation 21:4.

questions.question: How do the Jews react to Jesus' claim about eternal life in John 8:52-53?
options: They accept His teaching
They accuse Him of having a devil and question if He is greater than Abraham and the prophets
They ask for a sign
They ask Him to leave the temple
questions.correctAnswer: They accuse Him of having a devil and question if He is greater than Abraham and the prophets
questions.explanation: The Jews say, 'Now we know that thou hast a devil... Art thou greater than our father Abraham?' (John 8:52-53), showing rejection of Jesus' divine authority, reflected in similar opposition in Matthew 12:24 and Mark 3:22.

questions.question: What does Jesus mean in John 8:29 when He says, 'for I do always those things that please him'?
options: He acts according to His own will
He follows the will of the Father who sent Him
He pleases the Pharisees
He does what the crowds want
questions.correctAnswer: He follows the will of the Father who sent Him
questions.explanation: Jesus declares He always does what pleases the Father (John 8:29), indicating His perfect obedience and unity with God’s will, a theme central in Philippians 2:8 and Hebrews 10:7.
